p: Nymphaea lotus L. ( N. lotus), from the family Nymphaeaceae (water lily family), is a perennial aquatic flowering plant. It is native to Egypt and grows in various parts of Central Africa, West Africa, and Madagascar [ 24, 25]. N. lotus is known to possess numerous ethnomedicinal properties and often used in the treatment of rheumatic pains, tumours and cancers [ 26â€“ 30]. Reports of phytochemical analysis showed that the major bioactive metabolites in Nymphaea species are flavonoids and phenolic compounds, and that N. lotus contains very special macrocyclic flavonoids [ 31, 32]. Based on earlier studies, one can say that N. lotus would be a good source of new isolates with high antioxidant, anti-inflammatory and cytotoxic potentials.
